pages.text: $(major)Plasmids/$, like $(l:geneticsresequenced:items/dna_helix)DNA Helices/$, contain genetic information. However, this only comes in the form of $(l:geneticsresequenced:genes)Genes/$.
Plasmids default to $(bad)Empty/$, with no genetic information.$(br2)To set their Gene, use a $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/plasmid_infuser)Plasmid Infuser/$ to infuse DNA Helices into them.

This Plasmid has been infused with the $(l:geneticsresequenced:genes/scare_creepers)Scare Creepers/$ Gene.$(br2)Notice, however, that it $(bad)only contains 1 Gene Point/$.$(br2)Infusing more DNA Helices of the same Gene will add +2 Points each, while Basic Genes will add +1 each.

Once it's reached its maximum Gene Points required, the Plasmid will be marked $(minor)complete/$!$(br2)That means it's ready to be injected into a Syringe at the $(l:geneticsresequenced:blocks/plasmid_injector)Plasmid Injector/$.
